perturbation.original_text: Unless otherwise set forth in the applicable Facility Addendum with respect to a particular Product or Products, Customer shall pay all undisputed amounts due in the currency specified in the applicable Facility Addendum within sixty (60) calendar days from the date of the invoice. If Customer disputes all or any portion of an invoice, it shall be required to pay only the amount not in dispute, and in such event Customer shall notify Manufacturer of the amount and nature of the dispute. Payment by Customer of any amount reflected in any invoice shall not result in a waiver of any of Customer's rights under this Agreement. If any payment required to be made under this Agreement is not made within twenty (20) days of the applicable date when such payment is due (the "Late Payment Date"), interest shall accrue on such past due amount from the Late Payment Date until the date payment is actually made at a quarterly rate equal to the lesser of (i) the Three-Month U.S. dollar LIBOR (Reuters Page LIBOR01) on the Late Payment Date (or the next Business Day if such Late Payment Date is not a Business Day), and (ii) the maximum rate permitted by applicable Law. Time for any payments hereunder shall be of the essence.
perturbation.changed_text: Unless otherwise set forth in the applicable Facility Addendum with respect to a particular Product or Products, Customer shall pay all undisputed amounts due in the currency specified in the applicable Facility Addendum within sixty (60) calendar days from the date of the invoice. If Customer disputes all or any portion of an invoice, it shall be required to pay only the amount not in dispute, and in such event Customer shall notify Manufacturer of the amount and nature of the dispute. Payment by Customer of any amount reflected in any invoice shall not result in a waiver of any of Customer's rights under this Agreement. If any payment required to be made under this Agreement is not made within thirty (30) days of the applicable date when such payment is due (the "Late Payment Date"), interest shall accrue on such past due amount from the Late Payment Date until the date payment is actually made at a quarterly rate equal to the lesser of (i) the Three-Month U.S. dollar LIBOR (Reuters Page LIBOR01) on the Late Payment Date (or the next Business Day if such Late Payment Date is not a Business Day), and (ii) the maximum rate permitted by applicable Law. Time for any payments hereunder shall be of the essence.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction by modifying the grace period for late payments. The original text states a grace period of 20 days before interest accrues, while the modified text changes this to 30 days. This discrepancy could cause confusion and disputes regarding when late payment interest charges are applicable.

perturbation.original_text: (b) In the event that Customer wishes to extend the Territory with respect to a certain Product, Customer shall notify Manufacturer of such request and Manufacturer shall consider Customer's request in good faith. For the avoidance of doubt, in the event that the Parties agree to extend the Territory with respect to a certain Product, any resulting Manufacturing Change shall be treated as a discretionary Manufacturing Change and governed by Section 4.3(a).
perturbation.changed_text: (b) In the event that Customer wishes to extend the Territory with respect to a certain Product, Customer shall notify Manufacturer of such request, but Manufacturer retains the sole right to accept or reject the Territory Extension request without obligation. For the avoidance of doubt, in the event that the Parties agree to extend the Territory with respect to a certain Product, any resulting Manufacturing Change shall be treated as a required Manufacturing Change and governed by Section 4.3(b).
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Manufacturer shall consider Customer's territory extension request in good faith. The modified text contradicts this, saying Manufacturer has the sole right to accept or reject without obligation, while the last line changes the Manufacturing change to be treated as 'required' instead of 'discretionary'. This creates uncertainty about what rules or procedures should take precedence.

perturbation.original_text: 12.1 Supply; Rejection; Transition. (a) Customer shall at its own expense supply Manufacturer with the Customer-Supplied Materials identified in the applicable Facility Addendum. Customer shall supply Manufacturer with the Buy-Sell Materials at a price that Customer determines, subject to Section 3.2(c), and communicates to Manufacturer. At Customer's option, the Customer-Supplied Materials and Buy-Sell Materials may be delivered directly from Customer's Third-Party vendor to Manufacturer at the vendor's or Customer's expense. Customer or its vendor shall supply Manufacturer with a copy of the certificate of analysis for the Customer-Supplied Materials and Buy-Sell Materials no later than delivery of the Customer-Supplied Materials or Buy-Sell Materials to Manufacturer.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 Supply; Rejection; Transition. (a) Customer shall at its own expense supply Manufacturer with the Customer-Supplied Materials identified in the applicable Facility Addendum. Customer shall supply Manufacturer with the Buy-Sell Materials at a price that Customer determines, subject to Section 3.2(c), and communicates to Manufacturer. At Manufacturer's option, the Customer-Supplied Materials and Buy-Sell Materials may be delivered directly from Customer's Third-Party vendor to Manufacturer at the vendor's or Customer's expense. Manufacturer or its vendor shall supply Customer with a copy of the certificate of analysis for the Customer-Supplied Materials and Buy-Sell Materials no later than delivery of the Customer-Supplied Materials or Buy-Sell Materials to Customer.
perturbation.explanation: The original states that 'At Customer's option' materials may be delivered and that 'Customer or its vendor shall supply manufacturer with a copy of the certificate of analysis.' The modified text directly flips each so that 'At Manufacturer's option' the materials may be delivered and that 'Manufacturer or its vendor shall supply Customer with a copy of the certificate of analysis.' This contradicts the terms, and may lead to disputes.
